int-org-section.heading: Arts and Culture

alt-heading.usage: casee sacac ass mena sasia fea eerca
casee sacac ass mena sasia fea eerca

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association of Baltic Academies of Music

address.verbatim-address: ­c/o­ Musik­hochschule Lübeck, Grosse Petersgrube 21, 23552 Lübeck, Germany

org-entry.content-note: a regional network of music academies in the Baltic Sea region
organizes annual summer campuses, orchestral seminars, other regular seminars and festivals

org-entry.found-date: 1994 as the European Forum for Arts and Heritage, present name adopted in 2008
org-entry.content-note: aims to unite artists, poets, scientists, philosophers and others through mutual interests and friendship in order to promote creativity
org-entry.stats: mems: 145 cultural orgs and individuals in 24 countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Europa Nostra—Pan-European Federation for Cultural Heritage

address.verbatim-address: Lange Voorhout 35, 2514 EC The Hague, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: brings together orgs and individuals concerned with the protection and enhancement of the European architectural and natural heritage and of the European environment
has consultative status with the Council of Europe
org-entry.stats: mems: 239 orgs, around 100 supporting bodies, more than 1,500 individual mems, and country representations in 17 states
org-entry.content-note: publs Heritage in Action (annually), Annual Report , Scientific Bulletin

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: European Association of Conservatoires, Music Academies and Music High Schools
org-entry-head.alt-name: Association Européenne des Conservatoires, Académies de Musique et Musikhochschulen

org-entry.content-note: aims to establish and foster contacts and exchanges between and represent the interests of mems; initiates and supports international collaboration through research projects, congresses and seminars
publs e-mail newsletters (2-3 a year), project newsletters (3 a year), conf. proceedings, research findings, various other publs and websites

address.verbatim-address: Jan van Goyenkade 5, 1075 HN Amsterdam, Netherlands

org-entry.found-date: 1954 as an NGO, supported by private sources
org-entry.content-note: aims to promote cultural co-operation and democracy in Europe
holds consultative asscn status with UNESCO
holds annual General Assembly (2023: Belgrade, Serbia, in Oct.)

org-entry-head.abbr: IAA Latin America and the Caribbean

org-entry.content-note: facilitates regional bodies and asscns
co-ordinates regional events as the representative body of the International Association of Art

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Film and Television Schools
org-entry-head.alt-name: Centre international de liaison des écoles de cinéma et de television—CILECT

address.verbatim-address: c/o Stanislav Semerdjiev, 1000 Sofia, ul. Rakosky 108A, Bulgaria

org-entry.content-note: aims to link higher teaching and research institutes and to develop and promote the highest standards of education, research and training for film, television and related media
organizes confs and student film festivals
org-entry.stats: mems: over 180 audio-visual educational institutions in 65 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. Newsletter

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Board on Books for Young People

org-entry.content-note: aims to support and link bodies in all countries connected with the young people’s book sector
encourages the distribution of children's and youth literature
presents the Hans Christian Andersen Award every 2 years to a living author and a living illustrator whose work is an outstanding contribution to juvenile literature
presents the IBBY-Asahi Reading Promotion Award every 2 years to an org. that has made a significant contribution towards the encouragement of reading
sponsors Inter­national Children's Book Day (2 April)
publs Bookbird (quarterly, in English), Congress Papers , IBBY Honour List (every 2 years), special bibliographies

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Centre for the Study of the Preservation and Restoration of Cultural Property

address.verbatim-address: Via di San Michele 13, 00153 Rome, Italy

org-entry.content-note: assembles documents on the preservation and restoration of cultural property
stimu­lates research and proffers advice
organizes missions of experts
undertakes training of specialists
publ. Newsletter (annually, in English and French)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Centre of Films for Children and Young People
org-entry-head.alt-name: Centre international du film pour l'enfance et la jeunesse—CIFEJ

address.verbatim-address: End of Seif St, Phase 3, Shahrak-e Gharb, Tehran 1466893311, Iran

org-entry.content-note: serves as a clearing house for information about films for children and young people, the influence of films on the young, and the regulations in force for the protection and education of young people
promotes production and distribution of suitable films
awards the CIFEJ prize at selected film festivals
publ. CIFEJ Info (quarterly)
works for the devt of the comparative study of literature in modern languages
Congress held every 3 years (2025: Seoul, Republic of Korea, in July-Aug.)
publ. Literary Research (annually)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Confederation of Societies of Authors and Composers

org-entry.content-note: aims to protect the rights of authors and composers
reg. offices in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso (for Africa), Santiago, Chile (for Latin America and the Caribbean), Beijing, People’s Rep. of China (Asia-Pacific), and Budapest, Hungary (Europe)
committed to the conservation and communication to society of the world’s natural and cultural heritage
administers 30 international cttees, each devoted to the study of a particular type of museum or to a specific museum-related discipline
maintains, with UNESCO, a documentation centre
maintains a Red List of Afghanistan Antiquities at Risk (incl. pre-Islamic cultural and historic items that were believed to be at risk from the fundamentalist Taliban regime)
org-entry.stats: mems: 32 int. cttees, 119 nat. cttees, 45,493 professionals in 138 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. ICOM News—Nouvelles de l’ICOM—Noticias del ICOM (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Committee of Museums and Collections of Arms and Military History

org-entry.found-date: 1957 as International Association of Museums of Arms and Military History (IAMAM); present name adopted in 2003
org-entry.content-note: links museums and other scientific institutions with public collections of arms and armour and military equipment, uniforms, etc.; holds annual confs (2024: London, UK, in Sept.-Oct.) and occasional specialist symposia
publ. The Magazine (online)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council of Organizations of Folklore Festivals and Folk Arts

org-entry.content-note: works for the safeguarding, promotion and diffusion of traditional culture and folklore
accredited to the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Cttee
org-entry.stats: mems: 61 nat. sections, 32 assoc., 4 partner and 13 corresponding in 110 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. CIOFF Newsletter (2 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council on Monuments and Sites

address.verbatim-address: 11 rue du Séminaire de Conflans, 94220 Charenton-le-Pont, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the study and preservation of monuments and sites and to arouse and cultivate the interest of public authorities and people of every country in their cultural heritage
disseminates the results of research into the technical, social and ad­ministrative problems connected with the conservation of architectural heritage
holds triennial General Assembly and Symposium
org-entry.stats: mems: 30 int. cttees, 113 nat. cttees and 10,891 individual mems in 132 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs ICOMOS Newsletter (quarterly), Scientific Journal (quarterly)
serves as an umbrella body for international, national and local orgs active in all forms of dance

address.verbatim-address: c/o Meike Wagner, Dept of Culture and Aesthetics, Stockholm University, 10691 Stockholm, Sweden

org-entry.content-note: holds annual conf. (2024: Manila, Philippines, in July)

org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération Internationale des Archives du Film—FIAF

org-entry.content-note: encourages the creation of audio-visual archives for the collection and conservation of the moving image heritage of every country
facilitates co-operation and exchanges between film archives
promotes public interest in the art of the cinema
aids and conducts research
compiles new documentation
holds annual congress
org-entry.stats: mems: 94 active and 80 assoc. mems in 80 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Journal of Film Preservation (2 a year), FIAF International Film Archive Database (2 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Film Producers' Associations
org-entry-head.alt-name: Fédération Internationale des Associations de Producteurs de Films—FIAPF

org-entry.content-note: represents film production internationally, defends its general interests and promotes its devt

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Institute for Children's Literature and Reading Research
org-entry-head.alt-name: Internationales Institut für Jugendliteratur und Leseforschung

org-entry.content-note: an international documentation, research and advisory centre of juvenile literature and reading
maintains specialized library
arranges confs and exhibitions
compiles recommendation lists
org-entry.stats: mems: individual and group mems in 28 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. 1001 Buch (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Institute for Conservation of Historic and Artistic Works

address.verbatim-address: 3 Birdcage Walk, Westminster, London, SW1H 9JJ, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: publ. Studies in Conservation (6 a year)

address.verbatim-address: Maison de l'UNESCO, 1 rue Miollis, 75732 Paris Cedex 15, France

org-entry.content-note:
promotes access to music for all, and
musicians’ rights
org-entry.stats: mems: 65 nat. music councils, and over 50 int. and regional music orgs

org-entry.content-note: aims to maintain high artistic standards and the representative character of art festivals
holds annual General Assembly
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 100 regular int. performing arts festivals in 40 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. Festivals (annually)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Music Libraries, Archives and Documentation Centres

org-entry.stats: mems: 1,700 institutions and individuals in 50 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. Fontes artis musicae (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Committee for the History of Art
org-entry-head.alt-name: Comité Internationale de l’Histoire de l’Art

address.verbatim-address: c/o Jean-Marie Guillouët, Institut National d'Histoire de l'Art, 2 rue Vivienne, 75002 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: holds International Congress every 4 years, and at least 2 colloquia between Congresses (36th Congress: Lyon, France, in June 2024)

org-entry.found-date: 1947 (as International Folk Music Council) to further the study, practice, documentation, preservation and dissemination of traditional music of all countries
org-entry.content-note: holds ICTM World Conference every 2 years (2025: Wellington, New Zealand, in Jan.)
publs Yearbook for Traditional Music , ICTM Bulletin (2 a year)

address.verbatim-address: 21 bis rue Victor Massé, 75009 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote and protect the interests of musicians in affiliated unions
promotes the performing arts through audiovisual media
organises trade fairs, conferences, competitions and seminars for music and dance films to support the global performing arts film industry
promotes the devt of contemporary music
organizes world (new) music days and festivals

address.verbatim-address: Sq. Eugène Plasky 92-94, Box 13, 1030 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: aims to enable young people to develop through music, and to strengthen contacts between mem. countries
publ. JMI News (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: World Federation of International Music Competitions

org-entry.content-note: works to co-ordinate the ar­rangements for affiliated competitions and to exchange experience
holds annual General Assembly
org-entry.stats: mems: over 110 int. music competitions and 10 assoc. orgs

address.verbatim-address: 1332 Xinzha Rd, Jingan Dist., 200040 Shanghai, People’s Republic of China

org-entry.content-note: aims to facilitate cultural ex­changes and international un­derstanding in the domain of the theatre and performing arts
promotes performing arts/theatre at national and international level and facilitates international collaboration
organizes a World Congress (36th: Fujairah, United Arab Emirates, in Feb. 2023)
org-entry.stats: mems: 80 nat. centres and co-operating mems worldwide
org-entry.content-note: publs ITI News (3 a year), The World of Theatre (every 2 years)
aims to support a broad spectrum of Nordic cultural co-operation activities between Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden, the Faroe Islands, Greenland and the Åland Islands

org-entry.usage: ewyb edio casee sacac mena sasia fea eerca

address.verbatim-address: 100 quai Saint-André, Bureau 140, Québec, QC G1K 3Y2, Canada

org-entry.content-note: assists cities inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List to implement the Convention concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage (1972)
promotes co-operation between city authorities, in particular in the management and sustainable devt of historic sites
holds a World Congress every 2 years (2024: Córdoba, Spain, in Sept.)
publ. Newsletter (monthly)

address.verbatim-address: PAWA House, Roman Ridge, POB C456, Cantonments, Accra, Ghana

org-entry.content-note: aims to connect African creative writers, defend the rights of authors and promote awareness of literature
supports the organization of a Pan-African Writers International Literature Conference (2023: Makerere Univ., Kampala, Uganda, in Nov., celebrating the life and literary works of Abdurazak Gurnah)
org-entry.stats: mems: 61 nat. writers' asscns in the continent

address.verbatim-address: 167-169 Great Portland St, London, W1W 5PF, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: promotes co-operation between poets, playwrights, editors, essayists and novelists
holds PEN International Congress every year (2024: Santiago, Chile, in Sept.)
publ. PEN International (2 a year, in English, French and Spanish, with the assistance of UNESCO)

address.verbatim-address: 14 Stephenson Way, London, NW1 2HD, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: serves as a forum for discussion and exchange of knowledge on the history and cultures of Asia
publ. Journal of the Royal Asiatic Society (quarterly)

org-entry.found-date: 2012 as a partnership of international literary festivals
org-entry.content-note: aims to support and showcase the work of local artists on an international platform, to facilitate the creation of international literature projects, and to provide a forum for literary festivals to expand their artistic programme
aims to strengthen the status of crafts as a vital part of cultural and economic life, to link craftspeople around the world, and to foster wider recognition of their work

designates `craft cities’ across the world—locations known for particular products (for example Dehua, People’s Rep. of China: porcelain; Yogyakarta, Indonesia: batik; Mamallapuram, India: stone carving; Chimbarongo, Chile: wicker work; Artigas, Uruguay: jewellery and handicrafts made from agates and amethysts)
